member.name: T:System.Windows.Interactivity.Behavior`1
member.summary: Encapsulates state information and zero or more ICommands into an attachable object.
member.typeparam: The type the can be attached to.
member.remarks: Behavior is the base class for providing attachable state and commands to an object. The types the Behavior can be attached to can be controlled by the generic parameter. Override OnAttached() and OnDetaching() methods to hook and unhook any necessary handlers from the AssociatedObject.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Interactivity.Behavior
member.summary: Encapsulates state information and zero or more ICommands into an attachable object.
member.remarks: This is an infrastructure class. Behavior authors should derive from Behavior<T> instead of from this class.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Interactivity.Behavior.OnAttached
member.summary: Called after the behavior is attached to an AssociatedObject.
member.remarks: Override this to hook up functionality to the AssociatedObject.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Interactivity.Behavior.OnDetaching
member.summary: Called when the behavior is being detached from its AssociatedObject, but before it has actually occurred.
member.remarks: Override this to unhook functionality from the AssociatedObject.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Interactivity.Behavior.Attach(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Attaches to the specified object.
member.exception: The Behavior is already hosted on a different element.
dependencyObject does not satisfy the Behavior type constraint.

member.summary: Detaches this instance from its associated object.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Interactivity.EventObserver
member.summary: EventObserver is designed to help manage event handlers by detatching when disposed. Creating this object will also attach in the constructor.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Interactivity.EventObserver.#ctor(System.Reflection.EventInfo,System.Object,System.Delegate)
member.summary: Creates an instance of EventObserver and attaches to the supplied event on the supplied target. Call dispose to detach.
member.param: The event to attach and detach from.
The target object the event is defined on. Null if the method is static.
The delegate to attach to the event.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Interactivity.EventObserver.Dispose
member.summary: Detaches the handler from the event.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Interactivity.EventTrigger
member.summary: A trigger that listens for a specified event on its source and fires when that event is fired.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Interactivity.EventTriggerBase`1
member.summary: Represents a trigger that can listen to an element other than its AssociatedObject.
member.typeparam: The type that this trigger can be associated with.
member.remarks: EventTriggerBase extends TriggerBase to add knowledge of another object than the one it is attached to. This allows a user to attach a Trigger/Action pair to one element and invoke the Action in response to a change in another object somewhere else. Override OnSourceChanged to hook or unhook handlers on the source element, and OnAttached/OnDetaching for the associated element. The type of the Source element can be constrained by the generic type parameter. If you need control over the type of the AssociatedObject, set a TypeConstraintAttribute on your derived type.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Interactivity.EventTriggerBase
member.summary: Represents a trigger that can listen to an object other than its AssociatedObject.
member.remarks: This is an infrastructure class. Trigger authors should derive from EventTriggerBase<T> instead of this class.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Interactivity.TriggerBase
member.summary: Represents an object that can invoke Actions conditionally.
member.remarks: This is an infrastructure class. Trigger authors should derive from Trigger<T> instead of this class.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Interactivity.TriggerBase.InvokeActions(System.Object)
member.summary: Invoke all actions associated with this trigger.
member.remarks: Derived classes should call this to fire the trigger.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Interactivity.TriggerBase.OnAttached
member.summary: Called after the trigger is attached to an AssociatedObject.

member.summary: Called when the trigger is being detached from its AssociatedObject, but before it has actually occurred.

member.summary: Called after the trigger is attached to an AssociatedObject.

member.summary: Gets the source type constraint.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Interactivity.EventTriggerBase.SourceObject
member.summary: Gets or sets the target object. If TargetObject is not set, the target will look for the object specified by TargetName. If an element referred to by TargetName cannot be found, the target will default to the AssociatedObject. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Interactivity.EventTriggerBase.SourceName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the element this EventTriggerBase listens for as a source. If the name is not set or cannot be resolved, the AssociatedObject will be used. This is a dependency property.
member.value: The name of the source element.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Interactivity.EventTriggerBase.Source
member.summary: Gets the resolved source. If is not set or cannot be resolved, defaults to AssociatedObject.
member.remarks: In general, this property should be used in place of AssociatedObject in derived classes.
member.exception: The element pointed to by does not satisify the type constraint.

member.summary: Called when the source property changes.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Interactivity.Interaction
member.summary: Static class that owns the Triggers and Behaviors attached properties. Handles propagation of AssociatedObject change notifications.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Interactivity.Interaction.TriggersProperty
member.summary: This property is used as the internal backing store for the public Triggers attached property.
member.remarks: This property is not exposed publicly. This forces clients to use the GetTriggers and SetTriggers methods to access the collection, ensuring the collection exists and is set before it is used.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Interactivity.Interaction.BehaviorsProperty
member.summary: This property is used as the internal backing store for the public Behaviors attached property.
member.remarks: This property is not exposed publicly. This forces clients to use the GetBehaviors and SetBehaviors methods to access the collection, ensuring the collection exists and is set before it is used.

member.value: The name of the command this action should invoke.
member.remarks: This property will be superseded by the Command property if both are set.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Interactivity.InvokeCommandAction.Command
member.summary: Gets or sets the command this action should invoke. This is a dependency property.
member.remarks: This property will take precedence over the CommandName property if both are set.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Interactivity.InvokeCommandAction.CommandParameter
member.summary: Gets or sets the command parameter. This is a dependency property.
member.remarks: This is the value passed to ICommand.CanExecute and ICommand.Execute.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Interactivity.NameResolvedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data about which objects were affected when resolving a name change.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Interactivity.NameResolver
member.summary: Helper class to handle the logic of resolving a TargetName into a Target element based on the context provided by a host element.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Interactivity.NameResolver.UpdateObjectFromName(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Attempts to update the resolved object from the name within the context of the namescope reference element.
member.remarks: Resets the existing target and attempts to resolve the current TargetName from the context of the current Host. If it cannot resolve from the context of the Host, it will continue up the visual tree until it resolves. If it has not resolved it when it reaches the root, it will set the Target to null and write a warning message to Debug output.

member.name: E:System.Windows.Interactivity.NameResolver.ResolvedElementChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the resolved element has changed.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Interactivity.NameResolver.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the element to attempt to resolve.
member.value: The name to attempt to resolve.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Interactivity.NameResolver.Object
member.summary: The resolved object. Will return the reference element if TargetName is null or empty, or if a resolve has not been attempted.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Interactivity.NameResolver.NameScopeReferenceElement
member.summary: Gets or sets the reference element from which to perform the name resolution.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Interactivity.NameResolver.PendingReferenceElementLoad
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the reference element load is pending.
member.value: True if [pending reference element load]; otherwise, False.
member.remarks: If the Host has not been loaded, the name will not be resolved. In that case, delay the resolution and track that fact with this property.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Interactivity.TargetedTriggerAction`1
member.summary: Represents an action that can be targeted to affect an object other than its AssociatedObject.
member.typeparam: The type constraint on the target.
member.remarks: TargetedTriggerAction extends TriggerAction to add knowledge of another element than the one it is attached to. This allows a user to invoke the action on an element other than the one it is attached to in response to a trigger firing. Override OnTargetChanged to hook or unhook handlers on the target element, and OnAttached/OnDetaching for the associated element. The type of the Target element can be constrained by the generic type parameter. If you need control over the type of the AssociatedObject, set a TypeConstraintAttribute on your derived type.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Interactivity.TargetedTriggerAction
member.summary: Represents an action that can be targeted to affect an object other than its AssociatedObject.
member.remarks: This is an infrastructure class. Action authors should derive from TargetedTriggerAction<T> instead of this class.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Interactivity.TargetedTriggerAction.OnTargetChangedImpl(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Called when the target changes.
member.remarks: This function should be overriden in derived classes to hook and unhook functionality from the changing source objects.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Interactivity.TargetedTriggerAction.OnAttached
member.summary: Called after the action is attached to an AssociatedObject.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Interactivity.TargetedTriggerAction.OnDetaching
member.summary: Called when the action is being detached from its AssociatedObject, but before it has actually occurred.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Interactivity.TargetedTriggerAction.TargetObject
member.summary: Gets or sets the target object. If TargetObject is not set, the target will look for the object specified by TargetName. If an element referred to by TargetName cannot be found, the target will default to the AssociatedObject. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Interactivity.TargetedTriggerAction.TargetName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the object this action targets. If Target is set, this property is ignored. If Target is not set and TargetName is not set or cannot be resolved, the target will default to the AssociatedObject. This is a dependency property.
member.value: The name of the target object.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Interactivity.TargetedTriggerAction.Target
member.summary: Gets the target object. If TargetObject is set, returns TargetObject. Else, if TargetName is not set or cannot be resolved, defaults to the AssociatedObject.
member.remarks: In general, this property should be used in place of AssociatedObject in derived classes.
member.exception: The Target element does not satisfy the type constraint.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Interactivity.TargetedTriggerAction.AssociatedObjectTypeConstraint
member.summary: Gets the associated object type constraint.
member.remarks: Define a TypeConstraintAttribute on a derived type to constrain the types it may be attached to.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Interactivity.TargetedTriggerAction.TargetTypeConstraint
member.summary: Gets the target type constraint.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Interactivity.TargetedTriggerAction`1.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Interactivity.TargetedTriggerAction`1.OnTargetChanged(`0,`0)
member.summary: Called when the target property changes.
member.remarks: Override this to hook and unhook functionality on the specified Target, rather than the AssociatedObject.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Interactivity.TargetedTriggerAction`1.Target
member.summary: Gets the target object. If TargetName is not set or cannot be resolved, defaults to the AssociatedObject.
member.remarks: In general, this property should be used in place of AssociatedObject in derived classes.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the TriggerActionCollection.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Interactivity.TriggerBase`1
member.summary: Represents an object that can invoke actions conditionally.
member.typeparam: The type to which this trigger can be attached.
member.remarks: TriggerBase is the base class for controlling actions. Override OnAttached() and OnDetaching() to hook and unhook handlers on the AssociatedObject. You may constrain the types that a derived TriggerBase may be attached to by specifying the generic parameter. Call InvokeActions() to fire all Actions associated with this TriggerBase.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Interactivity.TriggerBase`1.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Interactivity.TriggerBase`1.AssociatedObject
member.summary: Gets the object to which the trigger is attached.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Interactivity.TriggerBase`1.AssociatedObjectTypeConstraint
member.summary: Gets the type constraint of the associated object.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Interactivity.PreviewInvokeEventArgs
member.summary: Argument passed to PreviewInvoke event. Assigning Cancelling to True will cancel the invoking of the trigger.
member.remarks: This is an infrastructure class. Behavior attached to a trigger base object can add its behavior as a listener to TriggerBase.PreviewInvoke.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Interactivity.TriggerCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of triggers with a shared AssociatedObject and provides change notifications to its contents when that AssociatedObject changes.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Interactivity.TriggerCollection.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: Internal, because this should not be inherited outside this assembly.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Interactivity.TriggerCollection.OnAttached
member.summary: Called immediately after the collection is attached to an AssociatedObject.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Interactivity.TriggerCollection.OnDetaching
member.summary: Called when the collection is being detached from its AssociatedObject, but before it has actually occurred.

member.summary: Called when a new item is added to the collection.

member.summary: Called when an item is removed from the collection.

member.name: P:ExceptionStringTable.CannotHostBehaviorMultipleTimesExceptionMessage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to An instance of a Behavior cannot be attached to more than one object at a time..

member.name: P:ExceptionStringTable.CannotHostTriggerActionMultipleTimesExceptionMessage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Cannot host an instance of a TriggerAction in multiple TriggerCollections simultaneously. Remove it from one TriggerCollection before adding it to another..

member.name: P:ExceptionStringTable.CannotHostTriggerCollectionMultipleTimesExceptionMessage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Cannot set the same TriggerCollection on multiple objects..

member.name: P:ExceptionStringTable.CannotHostTriggerMultipleTimesExceptionMessage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to An instance of a trigger cannot be attached to more than one object at a time..

member.name: P:ExceptionStringTable.CommandDoesNotExistOnBehaviorWarningMessage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The command "{0}" does not exist or is not publicly exposed on {1}..

member.name: P:ExceptionStringTable.DefaultTriggerAttributeInvalidTriggerTypeSpecifiedExceptionMessage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to "{0}" is not a valid type for the TriggerType parameter. Make sure "{0}" derives from TriggerBase..

member.name: P:ExceptionStringTable.DuplicateItemInCollectionExceptionMessage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Cannot add the same instance of "{0}" to a "{1}" more than once..

member.name: P:ExceptionStringTable.EventTriggerBaseInvalidEventExceptionMessage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The event "{0}" on type "{1}" has an incompatible signature. Make sure the event is public and satisfies the EventHandler delegate..

member.name: P:ExceptionStringTable.EventTriggerCannotFindEventNameExceptionMessage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Cannot find an event named "{0}" on type "{1}"..

member.name: P:ExceptionStringTable.RetargetedTypeConstraintViolatedExceptionMessage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to An object of type "{0}" cannot have a {3} property of type "{1}". Instances of type "{0}" can have only a {3} property of type "{2}"..

member.name: P:ExceptionStringTable.TypeConstraintViolatedExceptionMessage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Cannot attach type "{0}" to type "{1}". Instances of type "{0}" can only be attached to objects of type "{2}"..
